content.display_name: Learn to Speak English Fluently with Captivating Hindi Stories
content.overview: About the Course इंग्लिश गुरु में आपका स्वागत हैं! यह कोर्स का पाठ्यक्रम अनुसन्धान आधारित हैं! छोटी छोटी कहानियों के द्वारा, इस प्रोग्राम में विशेषज्ञों के मार्गदर्शनसे सरल बोली अंग्रेजी सिखानेका प्रयोग किया हैं ! इस कोर्स -बुनियादी स्तर की संरचना १९ भागों में की गयी हैं! प्रत्येक भाग में ४-५ पाठ हैं! भाग के अंत में भाग के पाठों पर आधारित परीक्षा ली जाती है, जिससे आप अपनी प्रदर्शन को ट्रैक कर सके! उम्मीद हैं आपकी अंग्रेजी सीखने की यह यात्रा आनंदायी होगी!. Welcome to English Guru Program! The Program attempts to help the user learn few simple words and sentences in English which can be used in day-to-day conversations. The Program is divided into 2 levels - Basic and Advance. Each level has Modules consisting of Lessons which cover small aspect of spoken English through Bi-lingual story based conversations. Each Module also has a short quiz for revision. Basic Level has 19 modules. You have to complete these 19 modules to graduate to Advance Level Features Key Highlights of the Basic Course (o) 19 Modules including 90 Lessons, Introductions, Summaries and Tests for each Lesson. (o) All lessons follow learning through situational stories (o) 100+ Questions and Answers (o) Live Sessions About The Partner English Guru English Guru Program attempts to help the user learn a few simple words and sentences in English everyday, which can be used in various day-to-day conversations and situations. The Program is divided into 2 levels - Basic and Advance. Each level has Modules consisting of Lessons which cover a small aspect of spoken English through Bi-lingual story based conversations. Each Module also has a short quiz for revision. Basic Level has 19 modules . You have to complete these 19 modules to graduate to Advance Level Testimonials Mohit Bhansali "Best course for spoken English! I really like the program, as it helps me in speaking English with my friends and teachers." Rekha Shanbhag "Wonderful Program! The idea to learn English through short stories is fun. I like the program very much." FAQs 1) Why should I enroll for English Guru Course? English has now become the second most spoken language in India, after Hindi. The need to speak and understand English now-a-days is extremely high, with people in not only urban areas, but also semi-urban and rural markets having felt the need for this language. 2) What is the English Guru Course? ENGLISH GURU, brings English learning through the learner’s native language, thus helping him cross the barriers of lack of opportunities and teachers, poor infrastructure and cost. 3) Which age group does English Guru caters to? English Guru caters to students from Class 5 onwards, a. who wish to get initiated into English speaking b. those who understand English but are unable to speak it properly. c. Those who know the basics of English speaking but are not confident about the correct pronunciation and wish to learn more about the language. 4) Which languages do English Guru teaches English through? English Guru teaches English through the following 8 Indian languages – Hindi, Marathi, Gujarati, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Bengali 5) What is the course structure of English Guru? The English Guru course consists of 2 Levels divided into various Modules and each module sub-divided into Chapters. The Modules are based on the CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) guidelines for spoken English. After each Module the user is assessed through multi choice questions based on the modules learned. Report card for the same is maintained for the helping user to assess his/her performance. 6) What is the teaching methodology of English Guru? English Guru course has attempted to teach English through simple day today conversations and short stories making it easier for the student to remember and use the phrases in daily life. 7) What should the student expect to understand at the end of the Basic program? In the English Guru - Basic course content handles topics like a. Self introduction and exchange greetings & pleasantries b. Courtesies & Polite phrases c. Manners & Etiquettes d. Formal & informal behavior e. Sentences of good wishes, congratulations, encouragement & affection f. Inviting, accepting, declining, consent & apology g. Using helping verbs like can, could, may shall h. Simple descriptions i. Stating likes and dislikes j. Simple Telephonic Conversation 8) Do you have any Live Teacher to answer our doubts and queries? English Guru Course will have Live Webinars , where Teachers will cover few of the topics in depth. A doubt clearing session will also be arranged, depending on the queries we receive from the students 9) What is the basis of the English Speaking Language learning product? The English Speaking product is based on The Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR). The program helps user in improving English speaking skills through short bilingual stories. The product is level based (Basic & Advance Level) with Topics divided into Modules followed by Modular Tests. 10) Do I have to finish Module 1 to access Module 2 and so on? Yes. The English Speaking program follows adaptable structure. You are expected to complete Module 1 Lessons and Test to access Module 2. New Modules will be enabled only on completion of the previous module 11) Can I re-take the Modular tests? Yes. You can retake the Tests. 12) If I have any doubts in the Lesson who will help me solve? You can share your questions on Discussion Forum. Our Teachers will be conducting Doubt Clearing sessions either Live or a recorded session will be uploaded on the Program answering your queries. Terms & Conditions 1) Payment will be collected in advance for the current academic year. 2) No transfers/Refunds allowed. 3) Do not share your credentials with others.
content.short_description: Learn different aspects of spoken English through bilingual story-based conversations in English and Hindi. Join our English Guru Program and improve your day-to-day conversations with just a few simple words and sentences.

content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 10)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. Cerebry (“us”, “we”, or “our”) operates https: www.cerebry.co/ (hereinafter referred to as “Service”). Our Privacy Policy governs your visit to https: www.cerebry.co/, https: www.cerebry.co/mathpractice/, and explains how we collect, safeguard and disclose information that results from your use of our Service. We use your data to provide and improve Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. Our Terms and Conditions (“Terms”) govern all use of our Service and together with the Privacy Policy constitutes your agreement with us (“agreement”). 2. Definitions SERVICE means the https: www.cerebry.co/ website operated by Cerebry. PERSONAL DATA means data about a living individual who can be identified from those data (or from those and other information either in our possession or likely to come into our possession). USAGE DATA is data collected automatically either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit). COOKIES are small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device). DATA CONTROLLER means a natural or legal person who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons) determines the purposes for which and the manner in which any personal data are, or are to be, processed. For the purpose of this Privacy Policy, we are a Data Controller of your data. DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS) means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. We may use the services of various Service Providers in order to process your data more effectively. DATA SUBJECT is any living individual who is the subject of Personal Data. THE USER is the individual using our Service. The User corresponds to the Data Subject, who is the subject of Personal Data. 3. Information Collection and Use We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you. 4. Types of Data Collected Personal Data While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you (“Personal Data”). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to: 0.1. Email address 0.2. First name and last name 0.3. Phone number 0.4. Address, Country, State, Province, ZIP/Postal code, City 0.5. Cookies and Usage Data We may use your Personal Data to contact you with newsletters, marketing or promotional materials and other information that may be of interest to you. You may opt out of receiving any, or all, of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link. Usage Data We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access Service by or through any device (“Usage Data”). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer’s Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. When you access Service with a device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of device you use, your device unique ID, the IP address of your device, your device operating system, the type of Internet browser you use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. Location Data We may use and store information about your location if you give us permission to do so (“Location Data”). We use this data to provide features of our Service, to improve and customize our Service. You can enable or disable location services when you use our Service at any time by way of your device settings. Tracking Cookies Data We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and we hold certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies are also used such as beacons, tags and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service. Examples of Cookies we use: 0.1. Session Cookies: We use Session Cookies to operate our Service. 0.2. Preference Cookies: We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings. 0.3. Security Cookies: We use Security Cookies for security purposes. 0.4. Advertising Cookies: Advertising Cookies are used to serve you with advertisements that may be relevant to you and your interests. Other Data While using our Service, we may also collect the following information: sex, age, date of birth, place of birth, passport details, citizenship, registration at place of residence and actual address, telephone number (work, mobile), details of documents on education, qualification, professional training, employment agreements, NDA agreements, information on bonuses and compensation, information on marital status, family members, social security (or other taxpayer identification) number, office location and other data. 5. Use of Data Cerebry uses the collected data for various purposes: 0.1. to provide and maintain our Service; 0.2. to notify you about changes to our Service; 0.3. to allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so; 0.4. to provide customer support; 0.5. to gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service; 0.6. to monitor the usage of our Service; 0.7. to detect, prevent and address technical issues; 0.8. to fulfil any other purpose for which you provide it; 0.9. to carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection; 0.10. to provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email-instructions, etc.; 0.11. to provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information; 0.12. in any other way we may describe when you provide the information; 0.13. for any other purpose with your consent. 6. Retention of Data We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. We will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods. 7. Transfer of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer. Cerebry will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information. . Disclosure of Data We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide: 0.1. Disclosure for Law Enforcement. Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities. 0.2. Business Transaction. If we or our subsidiaries are involved in a merger, acquisition or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred. 0.3. Other cases. We may disclose your information also: 0.3.1. to our subsidiaries and affiliates; 0.3.2. to contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business; 0.3.3. to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it; 0.3.4. for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website; 0.3.5. for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information; 0.3.6. with your consent in any other cases; 0.3.7. if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. 9. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. 10. Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights, covered by GDPR. In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights: 0.1. the right to access, update or to delete the information we have on you; 0.2. the right of rectification. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data; 0.4. the right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information; 0.5. the right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format; 0.6. the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information; Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Please note, we may not able to provide Service without some necessary data. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA). 11. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA) CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. According to CalOPPA we agree to the following: 0.1. users can visit our site anonymously; 0.2. our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy”, and can easily be found on the home page of our website; 0.3. users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on our Privacy Policy Page; 0.4. users are able to change their personal information by emailing us at info@cerebry.co. Do Not Track is a preference you can set in your web browser to inform websites that you do not want to be tracked. You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the Preferences or Settings page of your web browser. 12. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data and not to sell (share) it. To exercise your data protection rights, you can make certain requests and ask us: 0.1. What personal information we have about you. If you make this request, we will return to you: 0.0.1. The specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you. 0.0.6. A list of categories of personal information that we have disclosed for a business purpose, along with the category of any other company we shared it with. If you make this request, we will delete the personal information we hold about you as of the date of your request from our records and direct any service providers to do the same. In some cases, deletion may be accomplished through de-identification of the information. If you choose to delete your personal information, you may not be able to use certain functions that require your personal information to operate. 0.3. To stop selling your personal information. We don’t sell or rent your personal information to any third parties for any purpose. We do not sell your personal information for monetary consideration. However, under some circumstances, a transfer of personal information to a third party, or within our family of companies, without monetary consideration may be considered a “sale” under California law. You are the only owner of your Personal Data and can request disclosure or deletion at any time. If you submit a request to stop selling your personal information, we will stop making such transfers. Please note, if you ask us to delete or stop selling your data, it may impact your experience with us, and you may not be able to participate in certain programs or membership services which require the usage of your personal information to function. But in no circumstances, we will discriminate against you for exercising your rights. To exercise your California data protection rights described above, please send your request(s) by email: info@cerebry.co. Your data protection rights, described above, are covered by the CCPA, short for the California Consumer Privacy Act. To find out more, visit the official California Legislative Information website. The CCPA took effect on 01/01/2020. 13. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. content.short_description: Boost your math skills and confidence with unlimited problem-solving opportunities with a practice platform powered by AI. Enroll now to upgrade your grades and become a math wizard!

content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 11)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 8)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. Cerebry (“us”, “we”, or “our”) operates https: www.cerebry.co/ (hereinafter referred to as “Service”). Our Privacy Policy governs your visit to https: www.cerebry.co/, https: www.cerebry.co/mathpractice/, and explains how we collect, safeguard and disclose information that results from your use of our Service. We use your data to provide and improve Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. Our Terms and Conditions (“Terms”) govern all use of our Service and together with the Privacy Policy constitutes your agreement with us (“agreement”). 2. Definitions SERVICE means the https: www.cerebry.co/ website operated by Cerebry. PERSONAL DATA means data about a living individual who can be identified from those data (or from those and other information either in our possession or likely to come into our possession). USAGE DATA is data collected automatically either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit). COOKIES are small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device). DATA CONTROLLER means a natural or legal person who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons) determines the purposes for which and the manner in which any personal data are, or are to be, processed. For the purpose of this Privacy Policy, we are a Data Controller of your data. DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS) means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. We may use the services of various Service Providers in order to process your data more effectively. DATA SUBJECT is any living individual who is the subject of Personal Data. THE USER is the individual using our Service. The User corresponds to the Data Subject, who is the subject of Personal Data. 3. Information Collection and Use We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you. 4. Types of Data Collected Personal Data While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you (“Personal Data”). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to: 0.1. Email address 0.2. First name and last name 0.3. Phone number 0.4. Address, Country, State, Province, ZIP/Postal code, City 0.5. Cookies and Usage Data We may use your Personal Data to contact you with newsletters, marketing or promotional materials and other information that may be of interest to you. You may opt out of receiving any, or all, of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link. Usage Data We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access Service by or through any device (“Usage Data”). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer’s Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. When you access Service with a device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of device you use, your device unique ID, the IP address of your device, your device operating system, the type of Internet browser you use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. Location Data We may use and store information about your location if you give us permission to do so (“Location Data”). We use this data to provide features of our Service, to improve and customize our Service. You can enable or disable location services when you use our Service at any time by way of your device settings. Tracking Cookies Data We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and we hold certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies are also used such as beacons, tags and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service. Examples of Cookies we use: 0.1. Session Cookies: We use Session Cookies to operate our Service. 0.2. Preference Cookies: We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings. 0.3. Security Cookies: We use Security Cookies for security purposes. 0.4. Advertising Cookies: Advertising Cookies are used to serve you with advertisements that may be relevant to you and your interests. Other Data While using our Service, we may also collect the following information: sex, age, date of birth, place of birth, passport details, citizenship, registration at place of residence and actual address, telephone number (work, mobile), details of documents on education, qualification, professional training, employment agreements, NDA agreements, information on bonuses and compensation, information on marital status, family members, social security (or other taxpayer identification) number, office location and other data. 5. Use of Data Cerebry uses the collected data for various purposes: 0.1. to provide and maintain our Service; 0.2. to notify you about changes to our Service; 0.3. to allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so; 0.4. to provide customer support; 0.5. to gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service; 0.6. to monitor the usage of our Service; 0.7. to detect, prevent and address technical issues; 0.8. to fulfil any other purpose for which you provide it; 0.9. to carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection; 0.10. to provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email-instructions, etc.; 0.11. to provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information; 0.12. in any other way we may describe when you provide the information; 0.13. for any other purpose with your consent. 6. Retention of Data We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. We will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods. 7. Transfer of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. If you are located outside Singapore and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to Singapore and process it there. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer. Cerebry will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information. . Disclosure of Data We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide: 0.1. Disclosure for Law Enforcement. Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities. 0.2. Business Transaction. If we or our subsidiaries are involved in a merger, acquisition or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred. 0.3. Other cases. We may disclose your information also: 0.3.1. to our subsidiaries and affiliates; 0.3.2. to contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business; 0.3.3. to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it; 0.3.4. for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website; 0.3.5. for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information; 0.3.6. with your consent in any other cases; 0.3.7. if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. 9. Security of Data The security of your data is important to us but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. 10. Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights, covered by GDPR. We aim to take reasonable steps to allow you to correct, amend, delete, or limit the use of your Personal Data. If you wish to be informed what Personal Data we hold about you and if you want it to be removed from our systems, please email us at info@cerebry.co. In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights: 0.1. the right to access, update or to delete the information we have on you; 0.2. the right of rectification. You have the right to have your information rectified if that information is inaccurate or incomplete; 0.3. the right to object. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data; 0.4. the right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information; 0.5. the right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format; 0.6. the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information; Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Please note, we may not able to provide Service without some necessary data. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA). 11. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA) CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. According to CalOPPA we agree to the following: 0.1. users can visit our site anonymously; 0.2. our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy”, and can easily be found on the home page of our website; 0.3. users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on our Privacy Policy Page; 0.4. users are able to change their personal information by emailing us at info@cerebry.co. Our Policy on “Do Not Track” Signals: We honor Do Not Track signals and do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising when a Do Not Track browser mechanism is in place. Do Not Track is a preference you can set in your web browser to inform websites that you do not want to be tracked. You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the Preferences or Settings page of your web browser. 12. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data and not to sell (share) it. To exercise your data protection rights, you can make certain requests and ask us: 0.1. What personal information we have about you. If you make this request, we will return to you: 0.0.1. The categories of personal information we have collected about you. 0.0.2. The categories of sources from which we collect your personal information. 0.0.3. The business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling your personal information. 0.0.4. The categories of third parties with whom we share personal information. 0.0.5. The specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you. 0.0.6. A list of categories of personal information that we have sold, along with the category of any other company we sold it to. If we have not sold your personal information, we will inform you of that fact. 0.0.7. A list of categories of personal information that we have disclosed for a business purpose, along with the category of any other company we shared it with. Please note, you are entitled to ask us to provide you with this information up to two times in a rolling twelve-month period. When you make this request, the information provided may be limited to the personal information we collected about you in the previous 12 months. 0.2. To delete your personal information. If you make this request, we will delete the personal information we hold about you as of the date of your request from our records and direct any service providers to do the same. In some cases, deletion may be accomplished through de-identification of the information. If you choose to delete your personal information, you may not be able to use certain functions that require your personal information to operate. 0.3. To stop selling your personal information. We don’t sell or rent your personal information to any third parties for any purpose. We do not sell your personal information for monetary consideration. However, under some circumstances, a transfer of personal information to a third party, or within our family of companies, without monetary consideration may be considered a “sale” under California law. You are the only owner of your Personal Data and can request disclosure or deletion at any time. If you submit a request to stop selling your personal information, we will stop making such transfers. Please note, if you ask us to delete or stop selling your data, it may impact your experience with us, and you may not be able to participate in certain programs or membership services which require the usage of your personal information to function. But in no circumstances, we will discriminate against you for exercising your rights. To exercise your California data protection rights described above, please send your request(s) by email: info@cerebry.co. Your data protection rights, described above, are covered by the CCPA, short for the California Consumer Privacy Act. To find out more, visit the official California Legislative Information website. The CCPA took effect on 01/01/2020. 13. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose. 14. Analytics We may use third-party Service Providers to monitor and analyze the use of our Service. 15. CI/CD tools We may use third-party Service Providers to automate the development process of our Service. 16. Behavioral Remarketing We may use remarketing services to advertise on third party websites to you after you visited our Service. We and our third-party vendors use cookies to inform, optimize and serve ads based on your past visits to our Service. 17. Payments We may provide paid products and/or services within Service. In that case, we use third-party services for payment processing (e.g. payment processors). We will not store or collect your payment card details. That information is provided directly to our third-party payment processors whose use of your personal information is governed by their Privacy Policy. These payment processors adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of payment information. 18. Links to Other Sites Our Service may contain links to other sites that are not operated by us. If you click a third party link, you will be directed to that third party’s site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services. For example, the outlined privacy policy has been made using PolicyMaker.io, a free tool that helps create high-quality legal documents. PolicyMaker’s privacy policy generator is an easy-to-use tool for creating a privacy policy for blog, website, e-commerce store or mobile app. 19. Children’s Privacy Our Services are not intended for use by children under the age of 18 (“Child” or “Children”). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from Children under 18. If you become aware that a Child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from Children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers. 20. Changes to This Privacy Policy We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. We will let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update “effective date” at the top of this Privacy Policy. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page. 21. Contact Us If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by email: info@cerebry.co.

Use of Data Cerebry uses the collected data for various purposes: 0.1. to provide and maintain our Service; 0.2. to notify you about changes to our Service; 0.3. to allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so; 0.4. to provide customer support; 0.5. to gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service; 0.6. to monitor the usage of our Service; 0.7. to detect, prevent and address technical issues; 0.8. to fulfil any other purpose for which you provide it; 0.9. to carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection; 0.10. to provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email-instructions, etc.; 0.11. to provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information; 0.12. in any other way we may describe when you provide the information; 0.13. for any other purpose with your consent. 6. Retention of Data We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. We will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods. 7. Transfer of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. If you are located outside Singapore and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to Singapore and process it there. Cerebry will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information. . Disclosure of Data We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide: 0.1. Disclosure for Law Enforcement. Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities. 0.2. Business Transaction. If we or our subsidiaries are involved in a merger, acquisition or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred. 0.3. Other cases. We may disclose your information also: 0.3.1. to our subsidiaries and affiliates; 0.3.2. to contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business; 0.3.3. to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it; 0.3.4. for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website; 0.3.5. for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information; 0.3.6. with your consent in any other cases; 0.3.7. if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. 9. Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights, covered by GDPR. In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights: 0.1. the right to access, update or to delete the information we have on you; 0.2. the right of rectification. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data; 0.4. the right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information; 0.5. the right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format; 0.6. the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information; Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Please note, we may not able to provide Service without some necessary data. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA). 11. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA) CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. According to CalOPPA we agree to the following: 0.1. users can visit our site anonymously; 0.2. our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy”, and can easily be found on the home page of our website; 0.3. users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on our Privacy Policy Page; 0.4. users are able to change their personal information by emailing us at info@cerebry.co. Do Not Track is a preference you can set in your web browser to inform websites that you do not want to be tracked. You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the Preferences or Settings page of your web browser. 12. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data and not to sell (share) it. To exercise your data protection rights, you can make certain requests and ask us: 0.1. What personal information we have about you. If you make this request, we will return to you: 0.0.1. A list of categories of personal information that we have disclosed for a business purpose, along with the category of any other company we shared it with. Please note, you are entitled to ask us to provide you with this information up to two times in a rolling twelve-month period. When you make this request, the information provided may be limited to the personal information we collected about you in the previous 12 months. 0.2. To delete your personal information. If you make this request, we will delete the personal information we hold about you as of the date of your request from our records and direct any service providers to do the same. In some cases, deletion may be accomplished through de-identification of the information. If you choose to delete your personal information, you may not be able to use certain functions that require your personal information to operate. 0.3. To stop selling your personal information. We don’t sell or rent your personal information to any third parties for any purpose. We do not sell your personal information for monetary consideration. However, under some circumstances, a transfer of personal information to a third party, or within our family of companies, without monetary consideration may be considered a “sale” under California law. You are the only owner of your Personal Data and can request disclosure or deletion at any time. If you submit a request to stop selling your personal information, we will stop making such transfers. Please note, if you ask us to delete or stop selling your data, it may impact your experience with us, and you may not be able to participate in certain programs or membership services which require the usage of your personal information to function. But in no circumstances, we will discriminate against you for exercising your rights. To exercise your California data protection rights described above, please send your request(s) by email: info@cerebry.co. Your data protection rights, described above, are covered by the CCPA, short for the California Consumer Privacy Act. To find out more, visit the official California Legislative Information website. The CCPA took effect on 01/01/2020. 13. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 7)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions and stronger students face harder problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalized exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view on their class’ achievements as well as every single student’s precise learning journey and misconceptions. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus,cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course is organized into levels, following a curriculum-based game format for the entire year. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions specifically tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. Definitions SERVICE means the https: www.cerebry.co/ website operated by Cerebry. DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS) means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. content.overview: About the Course This course will help students develop structured thinking, enhance problem-solving skills and improve memory. Students will learn the art of doing mental mathematics quickly without making any errors. KidEx classes are conducted in a group format. All classes are LIVE & conducted over Zoom. Parents/students get the option to pick their preferred time slot from standard time slots for the activity. Most of the courses have multiple coaches. The child can attend a trial class with multiple coaches to determine which one is best for them. The course includes 2 assignments (after the 4th and 8th classes) that students must complete and get graded by the coach. Features Standard course curriculum designed by leading pedagogy experts in consultation with relevant teachers & educators Affordable prices Flexible batch size Certified coaches Regular assessment Fun & engaging classes Customized class slots Live Classes About The Partner KidEx is an experiential learning platform offering live online classes in small and large groups. All kinds of extracurricular activities and life skills like Chess, Rubik's Cube, Role Plays, Guitar, Keyboard, Vedic Maths, Keyboard, Karate, Kathak, Short Movie Making, Zumba, Bollywood Dancing, Public Speaking, etc are taught. KidEx organizes the largest inter-school competition called the National All Rounder Championship during the summer and winter vacations. To date, around 1,500+ schools and 1.25 lakh+ children have participated. KidEx's platform is available to third-party players, allowing them to organize their own intra-school or inter-school competitions. content.short_description: Remove maths phobia! Register now to boost your child's math abilities without the need for a calculator. with Mental and Vedic Maths techniques.

content.display_name: Make Your Child a Public Speaking Expert
content.overview: About the Course In this course, students will learn to structure their thoughts and speak confidently. Most adults have a fear of speaking in front of people, and this fear or anxiety usually starts in childhood. With some practice in a safe, judgement-free environment, children can easily get over it! In a small-group class, the child feels more comfortable speaking up and hears other kids practice. Students will: - Learn and practice different types of speeches: extempore, informative speech, expressing opinions and persuasive speeches (debate), poetry recitation, etc. - Learn how to use some grammar concepts to make their speech better - Learn techniques such as voice modulation, expressions, and body language Features 12 hours of live classes 20+ activities 4+ speeches written on different topics Certification Assessment Reports About The Tutor Ms. Archana Avinash is a certified communication specialist with over 10+ years of experience in soft skills and communication training. She has trained 1000+ students in effective communication and language skills. About The Partner Spark Studio is a global online extracurricular learning platform for children. They offer courses in communication, music, and arts. Founded by IIM and IIT alumni, they have - 30,000+ students from 9 different countries - 200+ partner schools in India - 100+ trained and experienced faculty - 15+ courses created by experts Recently, they were nominated as one of the 'Top 20 Most Innovative Edtech Startups' in the world by GSV. Course Structure 12 live Sessions 60 mins each session Certification COMPLETION CERTIFICATE Terms & Conditions Terms & Conditions We’re excited for your child’s course to begin. Here’s what to expect as you go through the course: Class joining: Endeavour to have your child join classes on time. It ensures that teachers are able to cover the curriculum, your child doesn't miss out & classes run smoothly. Pre-class requirements: These include materials, preparation, or an app that might be needed for the upcoming class. These are shared in advance. Kindly ensure your child is prepared and ready for the class with these. Post-class exercises: These exercises are not mandatory but they are designed to enrich your child’s learning and will help them get more out of the course. They are short exercises and guaranteed to be fun for the kids! End of course assignment: You will receive an end-of-course assessment only upon submission of the end of course evaluation assignment or the showcase, as relevant for the course. content.display_name: Prepare Yourself for NEET 2024 For Grade 12
content.overview: About the Course This course provides students of class 12 with the content of Physics, Chemistry and Biology mapped with the CBSE curriculum including NEET in the form of learning videos with 2D & 3D animations. The syllabus covered in this course is as per the standards of NCERT books and CBSE curriculum. It also contains notes, problem-solving videos and test papers. The content has been designed using several pedagogical techniques to ensure modular learning in a step-by-step manner catering to both academically average and gifted students. Features Content developed by subject matter experts with multiple years of teaching experience. Self-paced learning videos. Chapterwise notes. Chapter level and Subject level tests. Test guide videos for problem solving. Includes NEET test papers. About The Partner TutorMate is an online learning platform providing educational content created by an experienced team of subject matter experts to make learning easy, fun, and engaging. TutorMate adopts a 360-degree teaching-learning module to ensure understanding of core concepts using 2D and 3D animations in Video Lessons. They provide courses for Class 8-10th covering subjects like Maths, Science, English & Social Science for CBSE Board and Class 11 & 12th covering subjects like Physics, Chemistry, Maths & Biology with JEE and NEET Curriculum. FAQs 1. Does the content cover the entire high school syllabus? A. Yes, our content is exhaustive and in accordance with the NCERT textbooks according to the CBSE curriculum. 2. Are the notes provided the same as the content of the textbooks? A. The notes are a simplified and easy-to-understand version of the textbooks. Our notes will help you review and understand the core concepts of every chapter. 3. How are the practice questions evaluated? A. Our practice questions are all-encompassing and each of them comes with solutions for you to evaluate yourself before an exam. The questions aren’t restricted to just multiple choice questions but provide solutions to all long and short format questions. 4. Can students just stick to the content here, and nothing else? A. Absolutely. Our content is designed to help students understand the content thoroughly and is a one-stop-shop solution for all your examination needs. content.display_name: बच्चों में मोटापा
content.overview: About the Course Obesity in Kids - How to Promote Healthy Eating Habits in Kids Following point will add to make my presentation 1. What do you mean by healthy baby?2. Dangers of childhood obesity, how to identify your child’s ideal weight3. Factors contributing to excess body fat. 4. Tips to develop healthy food habits in your children’s Diet, action steps to eat right 5. Obesity and mental health, healthy brain begins with smart nutrition6. Healthy recipes; how to improve nutritive value in daily diet, basic tips. Features 1. Know the complications arising out of childhood obesity and importance of good nutrition. 2. Know the tips to control Childhood obesity 3. Know dos and don’ts while buying grocery for kids 4. Know the myths and misconception while selecting food groups About The Tutor Dt. Kanchan Patwardhan Dt. Kanchan Patwardhan, owner, Kanchan’s House of Health & Nutrition and national Health care Award winner. She also runs Dr Nutree Health products LLP which is an unique customer focused and revolutionary brand which manufactures premium health products with highest quality ingredients for daily consumption Dt Kanchan has a M.Sc. In Food & Nutrition and has a rich experience of 23yrs in the field of Nutrition. 1. She regularly appears on many TV shows like ABP MAZA, E TV, DD National, & was also the chief dietician in 100 days diet program on CARE WORLD TV. 2. Various programs have been done and recorded on ALL INDIA RADIO. 3. She is a national & international speaker she has been invited to radio shows in Mauritius and Dubai. 4. More than 500 columns, views and articles published in various leading newspapers and magazines such as Times of India, Hindustan Times, Asian age, Mumbai mirror, Mid day, Loksatta, Lokmat, Sakal, Maharashtra times, Health & Nutrition magazine, Grihlakshmi , Women etc. About the partner Kanchan's House of Health and Nutrition” is a brainchild of Dt. Kanchan Patwardhan (M.Sc. Food & Nutrition) with over 23 years of experience. She pursues nutrition and dietetics as a way of life and plays a vital role in propagating the importance of a balanced diet in shaping a healthy life in society.At Kanchan’s House of Health & Nutrition, we do not believe in gimmicks, quick fixes and unnatural claims while consulting and prescribing diet, which differentiates us from others. We believe in balanced diet and provide guidance in clinic through periodic sessions. Dt. Kanchan helps clients follow their diet easily by curating tasty and healthy recipes She has delivered successful results for ailments like :- Weight Management Diabetes Management Cholesterol Management program Diet for Pre & Post Pregnancy Child Related Nutrition Issues Skin Care through inner Nutrition PCOD & other Hormonal disorders Diet therapy for other medical conditions such as renal cardiac and hepatic patients. FAQs 1. How to contact Kanchan’s House of Health and Nutrition? One can contact us on phone 9833171695 or our website www.kanchanpatwardhan.in 2. How does Counselling & Consultation take place? Kanchan’s house of Heath & Nutrition provides counselling and consultations based on individual’s body type after analysing the same with equipment and pathology reports. Besides that, she is specialist in offering Weight Management, Diabetes Management, Cholesterol Management programs, diet for Pre & Post Pregnancy, Child Related Nutrition Issues, Skin Care through inner Nutrition, PCOD & other Hormonal disorders and Diet therapy for other medical conditions such as renal cardiac and hepatic patients. 3. Is it healthy for children to be on a diet? Yes, it is always healthy to follow nutritious diet for children for their proper growth and development. But it doesn’t mean to eat boiled or tasteless food correct eating is dieting.4. Are nutritional needs same for all children? Every child is unique and different from each other and their nutritional requirements are different and it is based on their age, body type, activities levels etc. 5. Is there any separate diet counselling for kids with special needs? Yes, there are different diet therapies for kids with special needs. 6. Are carbohydrates bad for your children? No not all carbs are bad for your children infect complex carbohydrates are excellent source of energy and it gives lots of micro nutrients too. Food selection is important. 7. Is there any food which are addictive in nature? Yes there are few food items which are sedative like substances that trigger the mind's pleasure focus and entice us into eating them over and over and act like drugs, however to a considerably lesser degree. Fortunately, there are healthy foods also available to overcome such problems in children 8. Are there online formats in view of pandemic? Yes, Kanchn’s House Of Health & Nutrition provide counselling and consultation services online also. 9. How does follow-up work? Kanchan’s house of Health & Nutrition provides excellent follow ups to motivate clients on regular basis. Each client gets one assistant dietician along with chief dietician to resolve their small or big queries. 10. About the duration and packages? We have different packages for different dietary needs pls contact us on 9833171695 for further information or visit our website www.kanchanpatwardhan.in
content.short_description: भारतीय परिदृश्य में अधिक मोटा होना स्वस्थ माना जाता है और इसी कारण बचपन का मोटापा दिन-प्रतिदिन बढ़ता जाता है। वास्तव में मोटापा ही सभी समस्याओं की जड़ है और इससे जीवनशैली में विकार उत्पन्न हो सकते हैं। भारत को मधुमेह की राजधानी कहा जाता है। इस वेबिनार में स्वस्थ भोजन, अच्छे पोषण के महत्व, बचपन के मोटापे के खतरें और इस गंभीर समस्या को काबू करने का तरीका बताया जायेगा।
