content.display_name: Learn to Speak English Fluently with Captivating Hindi Stories
content.overview: About the Course इंग्लिश गुरु में आपका स्वागत हैं! यह कोर्स का पाठ्यक्रम अनुसन्धान आधारित हैं! छोटी छोटी कहानियों के द्वारा, इस प्रोग्राम में विशेषज्ञों के मार्गदर्शनसे सरल बोली अंग्रेजी सिखानेका प्रयोग किया हैं ! इस कोर्स -बुनियादी स्तर की संरचना १९ भागों में की गयी हैं! प्रत्येक भाग में ४-५ पाठ हैं! भाग के अंत में भाग के पाठों पर आधारित परीक्षा ली जाती है, जिससे आप अपनी प्रदर्शन को ट्रैक कर सके! उम्मीद हैं आपकी अंग्रेजी सीखने की यह यात्रा आनंदायी होगी!. Welcome to English Guru Program! The Program attempts to help the user learn few simple words and sentences in English which can be used in day-to-day conversations. The Program is divided into 2 levels - Basic and Advance. Each level has Modules consisting of Lessons which cover small aspect of spoken English through Bi-lingual story based conversations. Each Module also has a short quiz for revision. Basic Level has 19 modules. You have to complete these 19 modules to graduate to Advance Level Features Key Highlights of the Basic Course (o) 19 Modules including 90 Lessons, Introductions, Summaries and Tests for each Lesson. (o) All lessons follow learning through situational stories (o) 100+ Questions and Answers (o) Live Sessions About The Partner English Guru English Guru Program attempts to help the user learn a few simple words and sentences in English everyday, which can be used in various day-to-day conversations and situations. The Program is divided into 2 levels - Basic and Advance. Each level has Modules consisting of Lessons which cover a small aspect of spoken English through Bi-lingual story based conversations. Each Module also has a short quiz for revision. Basic Level has 19 modules . You have to complete these 19 modules to graduate to Advance Level Testimonials Mohit Bhansali "Best course for spoken English! I really like the program, as it helps me in speaking English with my friends and teachers." Rekha Shanbhag "Wonderful Program! The idea to learn English through short stories is fun. I like the program very much." FAQs 1) Why should I enroll for English Guru Course? English has now become the second most spoken language in India, after Hindi. The need to speak and understand English now-a-days is extremely high, with people in not only urban areas, but also semi-urban and rural markets having felt the need for this language. 2) What is the English Guru Course? ENGLISH GURU, brings English learning through the learner’s native language, thus helping him cross the barriers of lack of opportunities and teachers, poor infrastructure and cost. 3) Which age group does English Guru caters to? English Guru caters to students from Class 5 onwards, a. who wish to get initiated into English speaking b. those who understand English but are unable to speak it properly. c. Those who know the basics of English speaking but are not confident about the correct pronunciation and wish to learn more about the language. 4) Which languages do English Guru teaches English through? English Guru teaches English through the following 8 Indian languages – Hindi, Marathi, Gujarati, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Bengali 5) What is the course structure of English Guru? The English Guru course consists of 2 Levels divided into various Modules and each module sub-divided into Chapters. The Modules are based on the CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) guidelines for spoken English. After each Module the user is assessed through multi choice questions based on the modules learned. Report card for the same is maintained for the helping user to assess his/her performance. 6) What is the teaching methodology of English Guru? English Guru course has attempted to teach English through simple day today conversations and short stories making it easier for the student to remember and use the phrases in daily life. 7) What should the student expect to understand at the end of the Basic program? In the English Guru - Basic course content handles topics like a. Self introduction and exchange greetings & pleasantries b. Courtesies & Polite phrases c. Manners & Etiquettes d. Formal & informal behavior e. Sentences of good wishes, congratulations, encouragement & affection f. Inviting, accepting, declining, consent & apology g. Using helping verbs like can, could, may shall h. Simple descriptions i. Stating likes and dislikes j. Simple Telephonic Conversation 8) Do you have any Live Teacher to answer our doubts and queries? English Guru Course will have Live Webinars , where Teachers will cover few of the topics in depth. A doubt clearing session will also be arranged, depending on the queries we receive from the students 9) What is the basis of the English Speaking Language learning product? The English Speaking product is based on The Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR). The program helps user in improving English speaking skills through short bilingual stories. The product is level based (Basic & Advance Level) with Topics divided into Modules followed by Modular Tests. 10) Do I have to finish Module 1 to access Module 2 and so on? Yes. The English Speaking program follows adaptable structure. You are expected to complete Module 1 Lessons and Test to access Module 2. New Modules will be enabled only on completion of the previous module 11) Can I re-take the Modular tests? Yes. You can retake the Tests. 12) If I have any doubts in the Lesson who will help me solve? You can share your questions on Discussion Forum. Our Teachers will be conducting Doubt Clearing sessions either Live or a recorded session will be uploaded on the Program answering your queries. Terms & Conditions 1) Payment will be collected in advance for the current academic year. 2) No transfers/Refunds allowed. 3) Do not share your credentials with others.
content.short_description: Learn different aspects of spoken English through bilingual story-based conversations in English and Hindi. Join our English Guru Program and improve your day-to-day conversations with just a few simple words and sentences.

content.display_name: Plethora Computational Thinking - Advanced
content.overview: About the Course Plethora Advanced course is designed for learners of age group 11-13 and focuses on teaching the core principles and skills of computational thinking, promoting computer science and software engineering practices. The topics covered by Plethora span from basic and simple ones in the Beginner course (like Cause and effect, User operations, and Parallelism) to advanced ones in the Advanced course (like Recursion, Real-time, and Local storage, and variables). With Plethora and its intuitive and appealing environment of visual rules, students focus on the algorithmic aspects rather than the syntax of the language. Accordingly, students can progress rapidly and reach stages where they learn aspects such as cause and effect, chain reactions, serial and parallel behavior, principles of abstraction and generalization, repetitive and recursive thinking, and more. The variety of concepts and ideas is easily accessible to students without having to get into complex issues in the field of software engineering such as objects, classes, inheritance, etc. Features Unique approach promotes teaching the foundations of Computer Science Over 200 levels to play Approved by the Israeli Ministry of Education and aligned with the CS4ALL standards Multilingual Course Structure This is the list of topics, concepts, and skills that are taught with Plethora in this course: Cause and Effect (25 levels) Students learn the concepts and meaning of events, rules, triggers, and effects. They identify the connection between a cause and effect and learn how rules can express these connections. User Operations (25 levels) Students learn about the possibility of human intervention in the behaviour of a system and how user operations can impact the flow and the final results of complex systems behaviour. Parallelism I and II (45 levels) Students get to know the meaning of parallelism and simultaneous actions. Stop conditions (15 levels) Students learn the need for defining a stop condition in an algorithm. Sequentially (25 levels) Students understand the difference between two events occurring one after the other or at the same time. Objects and properties (30 levels) Students learn the concepts of objects that are characterized by properties and behaviour. Conditional flow (15 levels) Students learn arithmetic comparison operators and the basics of control flow structures. Multiplicity (20 levels) Students learn the concept of multiplicity and activating an identical action on multiple objects at the same time. Abstraction (25 levels) Students learn the concept of abstraction that allows them to refer to objects, not necessarily in their concrete form but also in abstract forms. Iterative thinking (Loops) (25 levels) Students get familiar with the notion of iterations and iterative thinking using the loop construct. Recursive Thinking (25 levels) Students learn standard and mutual recursion. Compound Conditions Students see how conditional flow constructs can be expanded to refer to more than one condition and understand the different ways and meanings in which atomic conditions can be connected to a compound condition. About The Partner Active since 2017, Plethora is a joint venture between the Department of Computer Science at the Weizmann Institute of Science and CET, aimed at developing and practicing core, interdisciplinary skills of complex problem solving and computational thinking. More than 250,000 students already practiced Plethora. Plethora is approved by the Israeli Ministry of Education; it is located high in the list of recommended platforms for teaching Computer Science in Hour of Code and is formally acknowledged as aligned with Computer Standard and teaching standards of the international CS4All organization. Course Outcomes COMPLETION CERTIFICATE Privacy Policy Plethora Technologies Ltd. ("Plethora" “us”, “we”, or “our”) is the owner and operator of https: www.iamplethora.com/ (the "Website") and other products and services included therein (collectively, the "Plethora Platform"). We are committed to protecting your privacy. When you use the Plethora Platform, you trust us with your information. This Privacy Policy explains what information we collect when you use the Plethora Platform and how we use it and what rights you have in relation to it. Please read this Privacy Policy carefully as it will help you make informed decisions about sharing your Personal Information with us. This Privacy Policy applies to your use of the Plethora Platform, and if you do not wish to be bound by this Privacy Policy, and thereby do not consent to the collection and use of your information in accordance with it, you must cease any use of the Plethora Platform immediately. By using the Plethora Platform, you confirm that you have read, understood and agree to the collection and use of your information as we have outlined in this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy is incorporated into the Plethora Terms of Use (which can be found at https: www.iamplethora.com/policies/en/plethora-terms-of-service.pdf) and is an integral part thereof. 1. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT? In order to use the Plethora Platform, we may require you or you legal guardian if you are under 18 or the age of legal competence in your territory, to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including, but not limited to, your name, email address, and other information which may be used to identify you ("Personal Information"). The Personal Information that we collect may depend on the context of your interactions with us and use of the Plethora Platform. You can always refuse to supply Personal Information, however that may prevent you from using all or part of the features of the Plethora Platform. When the Plethora Platform is used, certain data may be collected automatically and/or generated by such use, such as device and usage information, your IP address, browser and device characteristics, operating system, language preferences, referring URLs, location, information about how and when you use the Plethora Platform and other technical information ("User Data"). 2. HOW DO WE COLLECT INFORMATION ABOUT YOU? Information you provide to us When you create an account and/or prior to using the Plethora Platform, we may ask you to provide us with certain Personal Information. Personal Information may also be collected when you contact our support or send us other communication. We may also collect Personal Information from you when you provide, upload, post, develop and create certain types of content, such as games, assignments, levels, and other creative items related to the Plethora Platform (the "User Content"). Information Automatically Collected We automatically collect User Data when you use the Plethora Platform. This User Data is technical information and does not immediately reveal your identity but may include device and usage information which may be Personal Information. Such User Data may include, amongst others, your IP address, browser and device characteristics, operating system, language preferences, referring URLs, location, information about how and when you use the Plethora Platform and other technical information. Cookies Cookies allow a web server to transfer data to a computer for recordkeeping and other purposes. Both session and persistent cookies may be used in connection with the Plethora Platform. These cookies are used for security purposes, to facilitate navigation, to display information more effectively, and to better serve you with more tailored information, as well as for online tracking purposes. We may also use cookies to gather statistical information about the usage of the Plethora Platform in order to continually improve the design and functionality, to understand how users use the Plethora Platform, and to assist us with resolving questions regarding the Plethora Platform. If you do not want information collected through the use of cookies, there is a simple procedure in most browsers that allows you to decline the use of cookies, however some features of the Plethora Platform may not work properly if you decline the use of cookies. Google Analytics We may use Google Analytics to help us analyze how visitors use the Plethora Platform. Google Analytics uses cookies to collect information about the number of visitors to the Plethora Platform, the webpage that referred visitors to the Plethora Platform, and the pages that visitors view within the Plethora Platform. To opt out of being tracked by Google Analytics, visit: https: chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/google-analytics-opt-out/fllaojicojecljbmefodhfapmkghcbnh?hl=en. Pixel Tags, Web Beacons, Clear GIFs or other Similar Technologies The Plethora Platform may use other technologies, among other things, to track the actions of Plethora Platform users, measure the success of our communications and compile statistics about Plethora Platform usage. 3. HOW DO WE USE YOUR DATA? We use the information we collect (including Personal Information and/or User Data) for the following purposes:  To facilitate your use of the Plethora Platform and to respond to your inquiries, solve any potential issues you might have with the use of the Plethora Platform and for other legitimate business purposes. Our “legitimate business purposes” may include, amongst others, creating and/or managing user profiles, personalized website content and communications based on your preferences, meeting contract or legal obligations, resolving disputes and enforcing the Terms.  If you choose to link your account with us to a third party account (such as your Google or Facebook account), we use the data you allow us to collect from those third parties to facilitate account creation and the logon process. We may use User Data to send you information regarding the Plethora Platform and changes thereto, as well as information about changes to our terms, conditions, and policies.  To enforce and/or protect our rights, property and safety of our users or any other person or entity.  In order to comply with and in order to assess compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, and internal policies and procedures.  To conduct analysis required to detect malicious data and understand how this may affect the user and/or our IT system, for statistical monitoring and analysis of current attacks on devices and systems and for the on-going adaptation of the solutions provided to secure devices and systems against attacks.  For ongoing review and improvement of the Plethora Platform to ensure it is user friendly and to prevent any potential disruptions, to understand feedback on the Plethora Platform, for in-depth threat analysis, and to develop new products and services.  We may use IP addresses for purposes such as calculating Plethora Platform usage levels, helping diagnose server problems, and administering the Plethora Platform. Please note that we treat IP addresses, server log files and related information as non-Personal Information, except where we are required to do otherwise under applicable law. 4. WILL YOUR INFORMATION BE SHARED WITH ANYONE? We may share information we collect (including Personal Information and/or User Data), for the purposes provided herein, and as follows:  If you have given us specific consent.  If you have received access to the Plethora Platform through a school, extracurricular activity operator, other educational entity or organization and/or an authorized reseller of the Plethora Platform (each an "Institution"), such Institution may be granted access to your Personal Information and User Data.  If we are legally required to do so in order to comply with applicable law, governmental requests, a judicial proceeding, court order, or legal process.  If we believe it is necessary to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding potential violations of our policies, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the safety of any person and illegal activities, or as evidence in litigation in which we are involved, all in accordance with applicable law.  With service providers and venders for the purposes of providing services to us (for example, accountants, IT and communications providers and debt collectors). Examples include payment processing, data analysis, email delivery, hosting services, customer service and marketing efforts. We may allow selected third parties to use tracking technology on the Plethora Platform, which will enable them to collect data about how you interact with the Plethora Platform over time. This information may be used to, among other things, to analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content and better understand user activity.  If we sell our business or assets, we may need to disclose our users Personal Information and User Data to the prospective buyer for due diligence purposes. We may also share information with parent, subsidiaries and affiliates, and investors of ours primarily for business and operational purposes.  User Content provided by you may be presented on the Plethora Platform and may be shared with third parties.  User Data that has been aggregated in a manner that cannot be reasonably used to identify you may be shared with third parties. 5. HOW LONG DO WE KEEP YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION AND USER DATA? We may keep and use your Personal Information and User Data for as long as necessary for the uses specified herein, and we may also keep and use your Personal Information and User Data as we may need to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce contractual rights. Note however we do not assume any obligation to store any information or data on the Plethora Platform and retain our right to delete any Personal Information and/or User Data. You may, however, ask that we delete certain data, as further detailed in Section 10 below. 6. HOW DO WE PROTECT YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION AND USER DATA? We implement what we deem as commercially reasonable technical and administrative security measures designed to protect the security of your Personal Information and User Data. Although we will do our best to protect your Personal Information and User Data, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, transmission of Personal Information and User Data to and from the Plethora Platform is at your own risk. You should only access the Plethora Platform within a secure environment. If you feel that the security of your Personal Information or User Data may have been compromised, please immediately notify us at hello@iamplethora.com. 7. Your Personal Information and User Data may be stored with server hosting and backup service providers. You consent to the transfer of information to countries outside of your country of residence (such as Israel and the USA), which may have different data protection rules than in your country. 8. content.short_description: Learn computational thinking with Plethora, an engaging online platform that uses gamification to teach learners of all ages. Plethora lets students focus on algorithmic principles instead of getting caught up in programming language syntax Register now to level up your thinking!

content.display_name: CREST Mathematics Olympiad (CMO) - Grade-KG - Registration for Olympiad
content.overview: About the Course Students across the globe participate extensively to make their mark in the Mathematics Olympiad for KG class. The set of questions in the CREST Mathematics Olympiad exam encourages students to apply their mathematical knowledge and test different skills like data interpretation, problem-solving skills, calculation speed, the ability to cover a vast syllabus, etc., and much more. The exam aims to sharpen the mathematical skills of the students. It is one of the best recommended online Maths Olympiads for KG class. Features 50% of students receive some recognition or award (highest among any other Olympiad Exam) Provision to the student to choose the date and exam time slot (if online) (innovative feature) Exams are webcam proctored Students can view and challenge answer keys (innovative feature) 7 Free practice tests are provided before the final exam (innovative feature) Course Structure The CMO for KG has two sections- Practical Mathematics and Acheiver's Section. About The Partner CREST Olympiads is Asia's most innovative Olympiad exam. It is an active community with more than 1 million students participating every year from 4000+ schools in 25+ countries. Assessment All the exams are parent/teacher assisted for KG students. Duration: 45 minutes Question Type: MCQ Number of questions: 25 Total Marks: 30 Certification Registration & Examination Dates The Last date of Registration is 31st August 2023 and 15th September 2023. Online Examination Dates:- Level 1 Exam - 2nd & 22nd Dec 2023 Level 2 Exam 6th Feb 2024 Offline Examination Dates:- Level 1 Exam - 11th & 19th Dec 2023
content.short_description: CREST Math Olympiad (CMO) is one of the most well-known exams among students. It has innovative questions and a very innovative platform that helps students prepare for future competitions.

content.display_name: Transform Your Child's Academics with Super Student
content.overview: About the Course Here’s what your child will achieve each day of the training: (4-Day Curriculum) Day 1 - How to master academic success mindset Day 2 - How to activate 3 key skills to boost memory and learn anything fast Day 3 - How to create high-performance routines, super students use to master academic success Day 4 - How to build a power-packed 40 mins study system and maximise results Day 5 – Session for Parents The cherry on the cake The actual value of this course is ₹ 999/- but as a special offer we are currently offering it for ₹199/- ONLY I will also be giving away some BONUSES as a token of appreciation for being an international parent:⠀ Bonus 1 - Free e-book (How To Raise Successful Children) valued at Rs.199Bonus 2 - Free A+ Student's Time Table at Rs.499Bonus 3 - Exclusive certificate of appreciation (Priceless)⠀ If you're serious about raising your child to be a Super Student who is Independent, Responsible, Consistent and Successful, then this 4-Day Digiclass is a MUST ATTEND for your child.⠀ Grab a spot for your child now!⠀ Why should students avail this course?  Helps students gain the required mindset that A+ students posses Students will learn how to activate the 3 key skills that boost memory and will help them learn anything fast Coaches students on the required routines and habits that are required to master school success and will help them later in life too Students learn how to build a power-packed 40 mins study system and maximise results Features Guided, step by step process for parents and students (supported by engaging worksheets and activities) The course is simple yet effective and works for every kind of learner Has been designed keeping in mind average to bright learners (designed by a psychologist & mother) Course Structure How many Sessions? 5 Sessions topics Day 1 - How to master academic success mindset Day 2 - How to activate 3 key skills to boost memory and learn anything fast Day 3 - How to create high-performance routines, super students use to master academic success Day 4 - How to build a power-packed 40 mins study system and maximise results Day 5 – Session for Parents About The Mentor Poonam Kage Dr. Poonam Kage is a personal growth coach for children and young adults. Drawing from successful workshops and training programs she has conducted, she is set on a mission to provide tools and techniques that empower parents and educators to support a child's growth to their fullest potential. Through her company 'RollerCoaster Edutainment', she offers DIY Kits, Social-Emotional learning & coaching, online courses, and personal development programs for children called 'The Big Leap' Programs, which act as a jumpstart for a child's life mastery. The Big Leap Programs are built on the strong pillars of Knowledge, Mindset, Skills and Habits that are necessary for children to thrive in class and life. She also helps parents tackle everyday parenting challenges with power, passion and purpose while making parenting a fulfilling experience. With a PhD in Psychology, having been a former expert faculty in psychology, and a life-skills trainer, she is also a certified Pre-Primary and Primary Teacher. Using the disciplines of psychology and personal potential, she hopes to take children through a personal transformation to create a new world of happiness and achievement.
content.short_description: Dr. Poonam Kage, a renowned personal growth coach for children and young adults, shares invaluable tips to enhance your child's academic performance. Register now to boost your child's success with these priceless insights.

content.display_name: వీడియోలు నేర్చుకోవడం-9వ తరగతి-గణితం (193 వీడియోలు) ఉచితం
content.overview: About the Course TicTacLearn Supported by Central Square Foundation and Google.org, has created one of the largest open-source repositories of high-quality, curriculum aligned digital learning resources available for everyone, free of cost available in Hindi, Telugu, English, Gujarati, Odia, and Marathi. This course is for CLASS 9 learners of Mathematics in HINDI language. About The Partner At TicTacLearn we believe that digital content has the power to reshape the learning spaces in the country and we want to take it one step closer to every learner, educator and parent. With that in mind we have created one of the largest open-source repositories of high-quality, curriculum aligned digital learning resources (12,000 videos, aligned item bank, etc.) available for everyone, free of cost! Furthermore, we know that educational resources are most effective when in the learners native language, and hence we aim to make our videos available in all major Indian languages. Terms & Conditions All TicTacLearn is freely available and is subjected to creative common license : CC-BY4.0
content.short_description: TicTacLearn నేర్చుకోవడానికి పూర్తి మరియు ఆనందించే మార్గాన్ని అందిస్తుంది! ఇది 1 నుండి 10వ తరగతి వరకు గణితం మరియు 3వ తరగతి నుండి 10వ తరగతి వరకు పర్యావరణ అధ్యయనాలు మరియు సైన్స్ పూర్తి సిలబస్‌ను కవర్ చేస్తుంది! కోర్సులు హిందీ, ఇంగ్లీష్, మరాఠీ, ఒరియా మరియు తెలుగులో అందుబాటులో ఉన్నాయి! కాన్సెప్ట్‌లు కథలలో బోధించబడతాయి మరియు నిజ జీవిత కోట్‌లపై ఆధారపడి ఉంటాయి! ఈ కోర్సు పూర్తిగా ఉచితం! కాబట్టి రండి మరియు త్వరగా నేర్చుకోవడం ప్రారంభించండి!

content.display_name: Get Ready for JEE and NEET 2024 - for Grade 12
content.overview: About the Course This course provides students of class 12 with the content of Physics, Chemistry, Biology and Math mapped with the CBSE curriculum including JEE & NEET in the form of learning videos with 2D & 3D animations which will help them to excel in board examinations. The syllabus covered in this course is as per the standards of NCERT books and CBSE curriculum. It also contains notes, problem-solving videos and test papers. The content has been designed using several pedagogical techniques to ensure modular learning in a step-by-step manner catering to both academically average and gifted students. Features Content developed by subject matter experts with multiple years of teaching experience. Self-paced learning videos. Chapterwise notes. Chapter level and Subject level tests. Test guide videos for problem solving. Includes JEE and NEET test papers. About The Partner TutorMate is an online learning platform providing educational content created by an experienced team of subject matter experts to make learning easy, fun, and engaging. TutorMate adopts a 360-degree teaching-learning module to ensure understanding of core concepts using 2D and 3D animations in Video Lessons. They provide courses for Class 8-10th covering subjects like Maths, Science, English & Social Science for CBSE Board and Class 11 & 12th covering subjects like Physics, Chemistry, Maths & Biology with JEE and NEET Curriculum. FAQs 1. Does the content cover the entire high school syllabus? A. Yes, our content is exhaustive and in accordance with the NCERT textbooks according to the CBSE curriculum. 2. Are the notes provided the same as the content of the textbooks? A. The notes are a simplified and easy-to-understand version of the textbooks. Our notes will help you review and understand the core concepts of every chapter. 3. How are the practice questions evaluated? A. Our practice questions are all-encompassing and each of them comes with solutions for you to evaluate yourself before an exam. The questions aren’t restricted to just multiple choice questions but provide solutions to all long and short format questions. 4. Can students just stick to the content here, and nothing else? A. Absolutely. Our content is designed to help students understand the content thoroughly and is a one-stop-shop solution for all your examination needs. content.display_name: Code Your Own Games with Scratch 3.0
content.overview: About the Course Scratch 3.0 This course is block-based programming in a virtual environment using sprites, drawing tools, object creation on the platform, to program and test on the virtual simulator. This platform has extensive learning resources and activities for practice. Evaluations are done by giving assignment activities and mapping student progress. Students can avail this course to learn how to design games, questionnaires, mathematical problems, designing the user interface and logical thinking, creativity, programming skill, and much more. Features Learning the various blocks and use of the same at various objectives in the course, eg. Loops, movements, lists, conditional programming, mathematical operators, etc. Students will also learn different add-ons like video sensing, pen tool, text to speech, translation to another language, and music. Evaluations at various levels to check the performance of every child. Ample of practice activities for the child to become confident in programming and tracking their progress with each activity. About The Mentor Mufaddal Kagalwala is a STEM trainer for students and educators. He has 10+ years of experience and has personally curated a number of products in the educational toy industry, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) domain. He is also the chief trainer for LEGO Education, Arduino Education, Strawbees Education, Kubo Education, Sam Labs. Having experience in the industry and designing so many products, he has taken up to educate students about STEM and its benefits. Having a career and focus on STEM is the next big bubble as compared to in the past in becoming a successful Doctor or Engineer, the reason today majority of the things are technology-driven. As a teacher, he has interacted with hundreds of students, trained, and built their interest in this field. Having said this the students have benefited by understanding the concepts taught to them in theory reinforced. Awards and Accolades Awarded to be the Chief trainer for Duck Learning India. About The Partner Established in 2007, Duck Learning was founded by, a third-generation Singaporean, after his own individual experiences in education as an adult volunteer leader in a newly established uniformed group and an as an educator. Thereby achieving success Duck Learning started its branch in India in 2016 at Navi Mumbai. Since then, they have been a growing organization with enthusiastic people in the STEM industry. They hosted two seasons of FLL India (International LEGO competition, whereby conducting Nationals of India and those students going international for competition), and STEM conference held in 2020 at Garodia International School, Ghatkopar. Their journey so far has been remarkable and hoping more to come around as per the new educational policy laid down by the education ministry in 2020. Course Structure How many Sessions? 24 sessions Session Topics 1.Topic Motion Outcomes Learn about various types of movements of sprites and objects Duration 40 minutes 2.Topic Looks Outcomes Learn to use different features to change sprites characteristic features, & make objects move. Duration 40 minutes 3.Topic Sound Outcomes Create sprites and objects and give them sound Duration 40 minutes 4.Topic Events Outcomes Give conditional starting to each animation or program based on user interface Duration 40 minutes 5.Topic Control Outcomes Learn about various commands like loops, if statements, if then else and more to add more functionality in the programs Duration 40 minutes 6.Topic Sensing Outcomes Use the add-on feature to use supportive tools to make the program sense different sprite/objects in your program Duration 40 minutes 7.Topic Operators Outcomes Making use of the various operator’s like maths, reasoning, comparison, other logical operators Duration 40 minutes 8.Topic Variables Outcomes Adding variables, changing variables, comparison etc. Duration 40 minutes 9.Topic My blocks Outcomes Creating custom blocks to perform a task either repeatedly or based on some condition for over single use Duration 40 minutes
content.short_description: Get ready to learn computer coding effortlessly! With Scratch 3.0, you can now code and play games on tablets and smart phones. Register today to start coding your projects and let the fun begin!

content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 11)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. Retention of Data We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. Transfer of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. Disclosure of Data We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide: 0.1. Disclosure for Law Enforcement. We may disclose your information also: 0.3.1. to our subsidiaries and affiliates; 0.3.2. to contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business; 0.3.3. to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it; 0.3.4. for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website; 0.3.5. for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information; 0.3.6. with your consent in any other cases; 0.3.7. if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. 9. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format; 0.6. the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information; Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA). 11. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA) CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data and not to sell (share) it. If you choose to delete your personal information, you may not be able to use certain functions that require your personal information to operate. 0.3. To stop selling your personal information. You are the only owner of your Personal Data and can request disclosure or deletion at any time. If you submit a request to stop selling your personal information, we will stop making such transfers. Please note, if you ask us to delete or stop selling your data, it may impact your experience with us, and you may not be able to participate in certain programs or membership services which require the usage of your personal information to function. But in no circumstances, we will discriminate against you for exercising your rights. To exercise your California data protection rights described above, please send your request(s) by email: info@cerebry.co. Your data protection rights, described above, are covered by the CCPA, short for the California Consumer Privacy Act. To find out more, visit the official California Legislative Information website. The CCPA took effect on 01/01/2020. 13. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. content.short_description: Mathematics through AI Practice Platform

content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 10)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS) means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. content.display_name: Cerebry Adaptive Mathematics Practice Platform (Grade 7)
content.overview: About the Course 1) Virtual Teaching Assistant: Cerebry adjusts to each learner’s proficiency; struggling students overcome lingering misconceptions, and stronger students face high-order problems. 2) Personalised learning for Students: Ready-to-use personalised exercises with an unlimited number of auto-graded problems to allow educators to focus on actual teaching and problem-solving. 3)Time Saved for Teachers: The problems and answer key are well explained. 4)Diagnostics and Reports for Teachers: Educators receive a detailed view of each student's achievements and also receive a precise learning journey. 5)No Plagiarism: Every student solves a different problem. Thus, Cerebry eliminates plagiarism with AI-generated questions. Course Structure The course improves the math proficiency of the students. The AI-driven platform helps them to practice and revise math problems anywhere and anytime. Subsequently, students can engage with assignments and exams to progress further. About The Partner Cerebry, the world's most advanced AI-driven adaptive math practice platform. Unlike other platforms that rely on question banks, Cerebry generates questions that are tailored to each student's needs. The platform creates topic-specific exercises according to the board curriculum, which can be administered in class or at home. Cerebry offers personalized practice exercises based on each student's proficiency level, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The platform also provides step-by-step solutions to problems, breaking down complex questions into manageable steps for students to practice. Assessment Cerebry provides assignments which can be used by school as per their own requirement. FAQs What is Cerebry Cerebry is an AI driven Math practice platform that helps students improve their conceptual understanding and scores. Cerebry has tailored Math exercises from grades 1-12 across various curricula like CBSE, ICSE, IGCSE, IB, GCE O-Level etc. Why should my child join Cerebry? Cerebry’s AI tool is powerful enough to understand the gaps that your child has in mastering a concept and provides personalized practice to get better results. One can learn at their own pace having unlimited access to practice the questions blended with interactive elements. It employs adaptive technology that focuses on vital issues, causing children to strain less and provide them with more playtime. What does a week at Cerebry look like ? The student gets to practice questions of various topics of a chapter in a week and an assessment is administered once the chapter is completed. Insightful reports of the skills mastered are generated with actionable items. What are the system requirements for me to practice Cerebry? No software installation is needed. Cerebry works on a standard browser and anyone with an internet enabled device is able to use it. Cerebry’s simple user-experience ensures students can start practicing within minutes. How are lesson plans and questions designed? Lesson Plans and questions are designed by subject matter experts tailored to the syllabus needs which take away the need to refer to the textbooks. The AI generates lots of questions of similar contexts and values for unlimited practice. Effective pre-made revision exercises are created with questions of the highest level. How can I buy a package in Cerebry? You can directly buy the package from our website, select the desired package and pay for it. Can I buy multiple packages at the same time? Yes, you can buy multiple packages. Please select the packages you are looking for from the home page. Can I reschedule the meeting in case I miss it? Yes you can reschedule the meeting. Book direct meeting slots here: https: meetings.hubspot.com/sonu-agarwal How can I keep track and be reminded about my child’s practice? Parents receive a detailed performance report from Cerebry that helps them track their child’s development and identifies areas for improvement. How do live doubt-solving sessions work? We answer questions, but only during a specific window of time. Privacy Policy 1.Introduction Welcome to Cerebry. COOKIES are small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device). Information Collection and Use We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you. 4. Types of Data Collected Personal Data While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you (“Personal Data”). Address, Country, State, Province, ZIP/Postal code, City 0.5. You may opt out of receiving any, or all, of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link. Usage Data We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access Service by or through any device (“Usage Data”). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer’s Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. When you access Service with a device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of device you use, your device unique ID, the IP address of your device, your device operating system, the type of Internet browser you use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. Location Data We may use and store information about your location if you give us permission to do so (“Location Data”). We use this data to provide features of our Service, to improve and customize our Service. You can enable or disable location services when you use our Service at any time by way of your device settings. Tracking Cookies Data We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and we hold certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies are also used such as beacons, tags and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service. Examples of Cookies we use: 0.1. Session Cookies: We use Session Cookies to operate our Service. 0.2. Preference Cookies: We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings. 0.3. Security Cookies: We use Security Cookies for security purposes. 0.4. Advertising Cookies: Advertising Cookies are used to serve you with advertisements that may be relevant to you and your interests. Other Data While using our Service, we may also collect the following information: sex, age, date of birth, place of birth, passport details, citizenship, registration at place of residence and actual address, telephone number (work, mobile), details of documents on education, qualification, professional training, employment agreements, NDA agreements, information on bonuses and compensation, information on marital status, family members, social security (or other taxpayer identification) number, office location and other data. 5. Use of Data Cerebry uses the collected data for various purposes: 0.1. to provide and maintain our Service; 0.2. to notify you about changes to our Service; 0.3. to allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so; 0.4. to provide customer support; 0.5. to gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service; 0.6. to monitor the usage of our Service; 0.7. to detect, prevent and address technical issues; 0.8. to fulfil any other purpose for which you provide it; 0.9. to carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection; 0.10. to provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email-instructions, etc.; 0.11. to provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information; 0.12. in any other way we may describe when you provide the information; 0.13. for any other purpose with your consent. 6. Retention of Data We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. We will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods. 7. Transfer of Data Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction. If you are located outside Singapore and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to Singapore and process it there. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer. Cerebry will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information. . Disclosure of Data We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide: 0.1. Disclosure for Law Enforcement. Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities. 0.2. Business Transaction. If we or our subsidiaries are involved in a merger, acquisition or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred. 0.3. Other cases. We may disclose your information also: 0.3.1. to our subsidiaries and affiliates; 0.3.2. to contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business; 0.3.3. to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it; 0.3.4. for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website; 0.3.5. for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information; 0.3.6. with your consent in any other cases; 0.3.7. if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. 9. Security of Data The security of your data is important to us but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. 10. Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights, covered by GDPR. We aim to take reasonable steps to allow you to correct, amend, delete, or limit the use of your Personal Data. If you wish to be informed what Personal Data we hold about you and if you want it to be removed from our systems, please email us at info@cerebry.co. In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights: 0.1. the right to access, update or to delete the information we have on you; 0.2. the right of rectification. You have the right to have your information rectified if that information is inaccurate or incomplete; 0.3. the right to object. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data; 0.4. the right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information; 0.5. the right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format; 0.6. the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information; Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Please note, we may not able to provide Service without some necessary data. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA). 11. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA) CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. According to CalOPPA we agree to the following: 0.1. users can visit our site anonymously; 0.2. our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy”, and can easily be found on the home page of our website; 0.3. users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on our Privacy Policy Page; 0.4. users are able to change their personal information by emailing us at info@cerebry.co. Our Policy on “Do Not Track” Signals: We honor Do Not Track signals and do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising when a Do Not Track browser mechanism is in place. Do Not Track is a preference you can set in your web browser to inform websites that you do not want to be tracked. You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the Preferences or Settings page of your web browser. 12. Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data and not to sell (share) it. To exercise your data protection rights, you can make certain requests and ask us: 0.1. What personal information we have about you. If you make this request, we will return to you: 0.0.1. The categories of personal information we have collected about you. 0.0.2. The categories of sources from which we collect your personal information. 0.0.3. The business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling your personal information. 0.0.4. The categories of third parties with whom we share personal information. 0.0.5. The specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you. 0.0.6. A list of categories of personal information that we have sold, along with the category of any other company we sold it to. If we have not sold your personal information, we will inform you of that fact. 0.0.7. A list of categories of personal information that we have disclosed for a business purpose, along with the category of any other company we shared it with. Please note, you are entitled to ask us to provide you with this information up to two times in a rolling twelve-month period. When you make this request, the information provided may be limited to the personal information we collected about you in the previous 12 months. 0.2. To delete your personal information. If you make this request, we will delete the personal information we hold about you as of the date of your request from our records and direct any service providers to do the same. In some cases, deletion may be accomplished through de-identification of the information. If you choose to delete your personal information, you may not be able to use certain functions that require your personal information to operate. 0.3. To stop selling your personal information. We don’t sell or rent your personal information to any third parties for any purpose. We do not sell your personal information for monetary consideration. However, under some circumstances, a transfer of personal information to a third party, or within our family of companies, without monetary consideration may be considered a “sale” under California law. You are the only owner of your Personal Data and can request disclosure or deletion at any time. If you submit a request to stop selling your personal information, we will stop making such transfers. Please note, if you ask us to delete or stop selling your data, it may impact your experience with us, and you may not be able to participate in certain programs or membership services which require the usage of your personal information to function. But in no circumstances, we will discriminate against you for exercising your rights. To exercise your California data protection rights described above, please send your request(s) by email: info@cerebry.co. Your data protection rights, described above, are covered by the CCPA, short for the California Consumer Privacy Act. To find out more, visit the official California Legislative Information website. The CCPA took effect on 01/01/2020. 13. Service Providers We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose. 14. Analytics We may use third-party Service Providers to monitor and analyze the use of our Service. 15. CI/CD tools We may use third-party Service Providers to automate the development process of our Service. 16. Behavioral Remarketing We may use remarketing services to advertise on third party websites to you after you visited our Service. We and our third-party vendors use cookies to inform, optimize and serve ads based on your past visits to our Service. 17. Payments We may provide paid products and/or services within Service. In that case, we use third-party services for payment processing (e.g. payment processors). We will not store or collect your payment card details. That information is provided directly to our third-party payment processors whose use of your personal information is governed by their Privacy Policy. These payment processors adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of payment information. 18. Links to Other Sites Our Service may contain links to other sites that are not operated by us. If you click a third party link, you will be directed to that third party’s site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services. For example, the outlined privacy policy has been made using PolicyMaker.io, a free tool that helps create high-quality legal documents. PolicyMaker’s privacy policy generator is an easy-to-use tool for creating a privacy policy for blog, website, e-commerce store or mobile app. 19. Children’s Privacy Our Services are not intended for use by children under the age of 18 (“Child” or “Children”). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from Children under 18. If you become aware that a Child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from Children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers. 20. Changes to This Privacy Policy We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. We will let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update “effective date” at the top of this Privacy Policy. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page. 21. Contact Us If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by email: info@cerebry.co.

content.display_name: వీడియోలు నేర్చుకోవడం-క్లాస్ 3-సైన్స్ (27 వీడియోలు)-ఉచితం
content.overview: About the Course TicTacLearn Supported by Central Square Foundation and Google.org, has created one of the largest open-source repositories of high-quality, curriculum aligned digital learning resources available for everyone, free of cost available in Hindi, Telugu, English, Gujarati, Odia, and Marathi. This course is for CLASS 3 learners of Science in HINDI language. About The Partner At TicTacLearn we believe that digital content has the power to reshape the learning spaces in the country and we want to take it one step closer to every learner, educator and parent. With that in mind we have created one of the largest open-source repositories of high-quality, curriculum aligned digital learning resources (12,000 videos, aligned item bank, etc.) available for everyone, free of cost! Furthermore, we know that educational resources are most effective when in the learners native language, and hence we aim to make our videos available in all major Indian languages. Terms & Conditions All TicTacLearn is freely available and is subjected to creative common license : CC-BY4.0
content.short_description: TicTacLearn నేర్చుకోవడానికి పూర్తి మరియు ఆనందించే మార్గాన్ని అందిస్తుంది! ఇది 1 నుండి 10వ తరగతి వరకు గణితం మరియు 3వ తరగతి నుండి 10వ తరగతి వరకు పర్యావరణ అధ్యయనాలు మరియు సైన్స్ పూర్తి సిలబస్‌ను కవర్ చేస్తుంది! కోర్సులు హిందీ, ఇంగ్లీష్, మరాఠీ, ఒరియా మరియు తెలుగులో అందుబాటులో ఉన్నాయి! కాన్సెప్ట్‌లు కథలలో బోధించబడతాయి మరియు నిజ జీవిత కోట్‌లపై ఆధారపడి ఉంటాయి! ఈ కోర్సు పూర్తిగా ఉచితం! కాబట్టి రండి మరియు త్వరగా నేర్చుకోవడం ప్రారంభించండి!
